name: Retro Reader: AKA the worst art program
name_original: Retro Reader: AKA the worst art program
description:
Retro Reader, AKA the worst art program, is a "dictionary-based coordinate" art program. if you can make art in this, I will be insanely surprised.  Basic tutorial:

Edit the values on the right 

ex:  "number": number2 <- this one

Syntax

0 = Red
1 = Green
2 = Blue  
3 = Red with an opacity of 50
4 = Green with an opacity of 50
5 = Blue with an opacity of 50
6 = White
7 = Black
8 = Nothing ( appears to be black )
9 = Orange ( it's for multi-layer coloring )
10-∞ = Nothing

Layers

Layers don't work as you'd expect.

 "Layer2": 0
indicates you are passing to the second layer
Everything past this is on the second layer.

The second layer is at 50% opacity, this is so you can mix colors.


Have fun

Example Art:

Copy and replace this in the text area.

Heart Meat
